scanexam.expressiontooltip: A valid expression will have the format 'a&b|a&c' meaning either box 'a' and box 'b' checked or box 'a' and box 'c' checked ('a' being the first box, 'c' being the third, ...)

scanexam.concatenationTooltip: Configure whether to create a pdf by merging (concatenating) the existing pdf and the new pdf or to replace the previous scan pdf with the new one (ticked means concatenation).
scanexam.debugTooltip: Displays the result of character detection
scanexam.allbindingsTooltip: Enables analysis to be run on all copies not yet bound
scanexam.bindTooltip: Allows you to associate this sheet with this student
scanexam.filterboundstudentTooltip: Allows you to filter students already assigned
scanexam.validaterecognizedTooltip: Allows you to associate the recognized student with this copy. This action can also be called using the keyboard shortcut ctrl + enter.
scanexam.gotonextnonboundsheet: Go to the next sheet not associated with a student
scanexam.gotopreviousnonboundsheet: Go to the previous sheet not associated with a student
scanexam.numeroTooltip: Question number for this zone. Several zones can be associated with the same number
scanexam.typequestionTooltip: Type of this question (MCQ for questions which have an answer in the form of a black box or manual for questions which will be marked manually by the marker
scanexam.manualgradetypequestionTooltip: When a question is marked manually by the marker, the latter can either assign an exact mark for an answer, or make comments which add or subtract points. The advantage of this type of marking is that it is possible to weight the marks assigned to a comment during the marking process and thus dynamically update the mark scheme
scanexam.nbrepageintemplateTooltip: Number of pages per student copy. (This figure is calculated automatically from the number of pages in the template). ‚ö†Ô∏è The number of pages in the scan must be exactly equal to the number of copies scanned multiplied by the number of pages in the template.)
scanexam.showmappingTooltip: Allows you to see the points of interest used to create the alignment. This often helps you to understand why problems during the scan of the copies caused difficulties during the alignment of the copies.
scanexam.showLayoutOptionsTooltip: Allows you to modify certain options associated with the name detection algorithm on copies
scanexam.showPaginatorTooltip: Allows you to navigate between scanned copies to assign them to one or more students in this module
scanexam.showFullPageTooltip: Allows you to view the scanned copy (in a modal window)
scanexam.factorTooltip: Allows you to increase the size of the zones (first name, last name, INE)
scanexam.gotonextnonboundsheetTooltip: Allows you to bind this recognized student with this copy
scanexam.showLayoutOptionsCorrectionTooltip: Allows you to change certain options associated with marking copies
scanexam.showPaginatorQuestionCorrectionTooltip: Allows you to navigate between questions for this paper. Ctrl + down (Cmd + down for Mac User) or Ctrl + up (Cmd + up for Mac User)
scanexam.showPaginatorCopieCorrectionTooltip: Navigates between copies of this question. Ctrl + left (Cmd + left for Mac User) or Ctrl + right (Cmd + right for Mac User)
scanexam.noAlignTooltip: Allows you to work from the unaligned sheets (useful when the alignment process has gone wrong)
scanexam.factorQuestionTooltip: Increases the size of the zones for this question (useful if the students have written outside the zones)
scanexam.shiftPageQuestionTooltip: Allows you to shift the pages (useful if a page is missing or if a sheet has been inserted during the scan). ‚ö†Ô∏è It is preferable and more comfortable to clean up the scan pdf when the scan is loaded via the thumbnail view
scanexam.starAnswerTooltip: Tag this response as an excellent response. It will be used to generate a standard answer key. Several answers can be tagged as excellent
scanexam.worstAnswerTooltip: Tag this answer as an outstanding (wrong) answer. This will allow you to find it quickly during the correction, for example to explain why this answer was not correct
scanexam.showLayoutOptionsCompareTooltip: Allows you to modify some options associated with the comparison layout or the clustering algorithm
scanexam.downloadAllTooltip: Allows you to download all the images (mainly for offline testing of automatic correction techniques).
scanexam.gotoCorrectionTooltip: Return to the correction (last corrected question).
scanexam.nbreClusterTooltip: Sets the number of clusters targeted by the clustering algorithm.
scanexam.showresultLienProfTooltip: Returns you to the correction view for this student
scanexam.showresultLienEleveTooltip: Allows you to see the view visible to the student after the correction has been sent (this is also useful for managing the sending of results without going through the platform).
scanexam.showresultLienPdfTooltip: Allows you to see the annotated pdf that will be generated if you choose to attach this pdf to the result email
scanexam.envoiemailTooltip: Allows you to configure the message and then send an email to students with the result of this exam
scanexam.exportExcelTooltip: Export the table below in Excel format. This export also contains the raw data for each question.
scanexam.exportCSVTooltip: Export the table below in CSV format. This export also contains the raw data for each question.
scanexam.voirStatistiquesTooltip: Provides a view with a number of statistics for this exam. Statistics, by student, by question, etc...
scanexam.voirReponsesRepresentativeTooltip: Lists the answers tagged as excellent or outstanding for each question
scanexam.envoiemailPdfTooltip: If ticked, an annotated pdf of the student's copy will be attached to this email. ‚ö†Ô∏è each email size will be larger.
scanexam.envoiemailAbsentTooltip: If ticked, an email will be sent to students who were absent during the exam.
scanexam.envoiemailActionTooltip: Send to each student with the above message body.
scanexam.statToggleValueTooltip: Toggles between raw and normalized values
scanexam.voirCopieStatistiquesTooltip: Go to the correction view for this student
scanexam.voirCopieFullPageTooltip: View the scanned copy for this student (in a modal window).
scanexam.pasdepageassocieeNextTooltip: There is no more sheet to associate following this sheet.
scanexam.pasdepageassocieePreviousTooltip: There is no sheet to associate prior to this sheet
scanexam.replacealignementWithNonAlignTooltip: Replaces the aligned version with the non-aligned version for this sheet
scanexam.pasdepageassocieeTooltip: There is no more sheet to associate for this exam
scanexam.nbreCoreTooltip: The more cores you use to perform this alignment operation, the more CPU and memory resources you will consume. Don't hesitate to lower this number if this step is too demanding on your browser.
scanexam.showAlignementOptionsTooltip: Enables you to modify certain options associated with the sheet alignment algorithm
scanexam.editCommentTooltip: Edit the values for this comment (even if the title or description have not been defined beforehand)
scanexam.fontsizeTooltip: Used to adjust the font size
scanexam.colourTooltip: Choice of color for text and lines
scanexam.scalefactorTooltip: Used to change the page scaling factor
scanexam.gotoCorrectionTooltipView: Used to go to the correction view when you are logged in as a teacher
scanexam.editquestionTooltip: Enables you to edit the properties of the question to update the scoring
scanexam.firsthelpdetail:
This view gives you access to 6 important stages in the marking process.
  • Step 1 (Annotate template) allows you to identify the areas of interest in your exam paper and build your mark scheme.
  • Step 2 and 3 (Upload student scan and Straighten scan) allows you to upload your pdf containing the scans and build a local cache of all the pages in the scan pdf as aligned and unaligned images. This cache is then synchronized with the server so that it can be downloaded by a colleague accessing the exam correction or by yourself if you change browser or devices (correction on tablet for example). of data loss. It is always possible to rebuild the cache by repeating step 2 click on Reanalyze from pdf, then repeat step 3 (page alignment). In each of these steps, you can see the state of the cache through the thumbnail part present in step 2, cache of unaligned images and step 3, cache of aligned images.
  • Step 4 allows each copy to be associated with one or more students present in the list of students imported when a module is created.
  • To access step 5 (Correct copy) and step 6 (View results) , the following condition must be satisfied:
    number ofnonaligned pages in cache == nbrepagesaligned in cache and nbreassociationandstudent == nbrepagesaligned / nbrepagedintemplate.
    (For example, if I have three pages in my template, 12 pages in the scan pdf so 12 aligned images and 12 unaligned images in the cache and 4 associated copies then I can access the correction) If this condition is not met then it is not possible to access either the correction or the result phase.

Very generally, if you encounter a problem at this point. It's either that your local cache isn't good, or that the number of associated copies doesn't match the ratio, number of sheets in the cache / no. of sheets in the template. You can access this information on the status of your cache by clicking on the information icon in the dock at the top of this page.
scanexam.infodetail: Provides information on the exam cache, so that you can sometimes understand why it is not possible to access the correction and result stage
scanexam.infoExamDetails:
For this review there are:
  • {{nbrepagenonalign}} unaligned image(s) in cache.
  • {{nbrepagealign}} aligned image(s) in cache.
  • {{nbrepagetemplate}} image(s) from the exam statement in cache.
  • {{nbrecopie}} associated copy(ies).
    • .

    As a result, the condition numberpagesnonaligned in cache == nnumberpagesaligned in cache evaluates to {{cond1}} and the condition numberassociationstudent == nnumberpagesaligned / nnumberpagedintemplate evaluates to {{cond2}}.

    The global constraint to access the correction is evaluated to {{cond3}}.
scanexam.firsthelpcoursedetail:
This page allows you to create one or more exams for your course and load the list of students for this course. This is because in correctExam, a course is associated with a list of students. üõà So from one year to the next, it's best to recreate a new course.

We offer an import/export mechanism with or without student data, which makes it possible to retrieve data from another instance of correctExam or to import an exam from a previous year without student data.

On this page, you can also control the sharing of your course with colleagues who need to help you with marking. There is no notion of access rights. A colleague with whom you share your module will have exactly the same rights as you (We're still colleagues first and foremost üôÇ ).

This page also allows you to delete the module. Warning, this action is irreversible.
scanexam.bindAllTooltip: Lets you associate all copies whose recognition score is greater than or equal to the score of this copy.
scanexam.hybridcommentGradeTooltip: This is used to decide the grade associated with this comment, which can be positive or negative and expressed as a point (absolute) or as a percentage (relative). Note that in the scoring mode, once all the comments have been applied by the marker, a student's mark for a question cannot be lower than zero in hybrid mode, nor can it exceed the maximum mark associated with that question.
scanexam.hybridcommentStepTooltip: Used to indicate whether the marker can divide the value of this comment into a number of slices. For example, if the mark for this comment is 80% of the overall mark and the number of brackets is 2, the marker may not apply this comment, apply this comment with one slice (40% of the overall mark) or apply this comment with two slices (80% of the overall mark).
scanexam.stepPage: Number of images processed in batch
scanexam.stepPageTooltip: Used to configure the number of images processed in batch before memory is released
scanexam.sortCommentTooltip: Sets a specific order for displaying comments
scanexam.hybridcommentStepCalculTooltip: Computation rules  = (number of points for the comment or question percentage) * number of steps affected / maximum possible number of steps
scanexam.contourLengthTooltip: One-dimensional Kmeans based on contour length
scanexam.contourLengthAndNbreContourTooltip: Two-dimensional Kmeans based on the length of contours and the number of contours with more than three pixels
scanexam.exportCsv: Export module grades in CSV format
scanexam.exportExcel: Export module grades in Excel format
scanexam.exportCsvdetail: Export grades for all exams in the module in CSV format
scanexam.exportExceldetail: Export grades for all exams in the module in Excel format (with details for each exam)
scanexam.processimpairtitle: Management of double-sided scanning when the exam template has an odd number of pages
scanexam.processimpairmessage: Did you scan as double-sided? If so, do you want to keep the last page of each scanned copy?
scanexam.randomcorrectionTooltip: Allows the marker to propose a random order in which the exam sheets are evaluated for this question.
scanexam.togglefocusView: Hides non-essential widgets, so you can focus on correcting them
scanexam.zenviewTooltip: Allows you to have a view with less widgets so that you can focus on the correction (you can use the keyboard shortcuts, the list is available using F1).
scanexam.forceeditTooltip: This allows you to force the editing of the properties of the current question, ‚ö†Ô∏è You have made corrections for this question, it is not recommended to change these properties during correction, it is better to migrate your correction mode to hybrid mode (this offers more flexibility in updating the scale during correction).
scanexam.clickbuttonsauveretudiant: ‚ö†Ô∏è: Don't forget to click on 'Save student list'.
scanexam.gotonextquestion: In horizontal correction, switches to the first exam sheet for the next question
scanexam.gotonextstudent: In vertical correction, switches to the first question for the next exam sheet (student)
scanexam.gotopreviousquestion: In horizontal correction, switches to the last exam sheet for the previous question
scanexam.gotopreviousstudent: In vertical correction, switches to the last question for the previous exam sheet (student)
scanexam.canbenegative: Permits a negative mark for this question
scanexam.canbenegativetooltip: If all the comments selected lead to a score of less than zero, this question may reduce the overall exam score for this exam sheet.
scanexam.mustbeignoreinglobalscale: Ignore this question in the global scale
scanexam.mustbeignoreinglobalscaletooltip: This allows the points awarded for this question to be ignored for the overall scale. For example, if you create a question to manage absences from class, this 3-point question can be used to deduct up to three points from the copy, but the grade remains 20, for example.)
scanexam.canexceedthemaxtooltip: If all the comments selected lead to a mark higher than the maximum score for this question, this question may increase the overall exam score for this exam sheet.
scanexam.canexceedthemax: Permits a mark above the scale for this question
scanexam.svgchoosesvgtooltip: Allows a new graphic comment to be loaded via an SVG file
scanexam.svgloadtooltip: Allows you to load a new graphical comment via a text file in SVG format as described in the figure above
scanexam.svgimporttooltip: Import the set of SVG images used in correctExam for use on another browser
scanexam.svgexporttooltip: Export the set of SVG images used in correctExam for use on another browser
scanexam.svgdialogtitle: Manage graphic comments in SVG format
scanexam.associeretnext: Bind and go to the next
scanexam.suppressioncopieTooltip: This action deletes all the pages in this copy from the cache
scanexam.rotationcopieTooltip: This action rotates all the pages in this copy of the cache by 180¬∞
scanexam.moreoperationTooltip: This button allows you to perform more complex actions on images from the pdf, (deletion by page number, rotation by page number, ...)‚Äù, ‚ÄúmoreoperationTooltip‚Äù: ‚ÄúThis button allows you to perform more complex actions on images from the pdf, (deletion by page number, rotation by page number, ...)
scanexam.removeallperpage: Removal by page number from each copy
scanexam.removeallperpageTooltip: Remove the {{page}} page from each copy, you can always go back by restarting the scan from the pdf
scanexam.rotateallperpage: Rotate each copy by page number
scanexam.rotateallperpageTooltip: Rotate the {{page}} page of each copy
